item.title: anaconda tutorial
item.description: Create a specific python environment conda create -n p36workshop python=3.6 ipykernel jupyter anaconda source activate p36workshop ipython kernel install --name p36workshop --user # OR python -m ipykernel install --user --name p36workshop Be sure to conda activate p36workshop before you use conda install or pip install conda env list: a list of environments conda list: a list of all packages installed in the current environment conda list 'tensorflow|pytorch': a list of all different versions of packges install a package for a specific python environment conda install --name py36 pytorch conda install -c conda-forge tensorflow=1.

item.title: Fast multi-level model with lme4
item.description: References: Steven V. Miller: Mixed Effects Modeling Tips: Use a Fast Optimizer, but Perform Optimizer Checks lme4: lme4 Performance Tips lme4::glmer vs. Stata’s melogit command library(lme4) f_lmer4_logit2 <- glmer(y ~ x1 + x2 + (1 + x1 | id), data = z, family = binomial(link = "logit"), nAGQ = 0L, control = glmerControl(optimizer="NLOPT_LN_BOBYQA", calc.derivs = FALSE, optCtrl=list(maxfun=2e5, method = "nlminb", starttests = FALSE, kkt = FALSE)))

item.title: 一些阅读清单
item.description: 因果推断 Causal Inference Reading Group Steven V. Miller: An Illustration of Instrumental Variables and a Two-Stage Least Squares (2SLS) Regression Instrumental variable lecture Andrew Heisis: PROGRAM EVALUATION FOR PUBLIC SERVICE Andrew Heisis: ECONOMY, SOCIETY, AND PUBLIC POLICY 空间统计 Geospatial Health Data: Modeling and Visualization with R-INLA and Shiny Advanced Spatial Modeling with Stochastic Partial Differential Equations Using R and INLA spatial data science Bayesian inference with INLA Bivariate Choropleth Maps: A How-to Guide Roger Bivand: ECS 530 Spatial data analysis Spatial Data Analysis with INLA 数据可视化 Andrew Heisis: Telling stories with data Andrew Heisis: Data Visualization Linear mixed effects models Understanding mixed effects models through data simulation Symbolic Formulae for Linear Mixed Models BART Chipman (2010) BART: Bayesian additive regression trees Sparapani (2016) Nonparametric survival analysis using Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) Deep learning Deep learning with python Deep learning with python notebook Causal Interpretations of Black-Box Models Parallel computing in R A Future for R: A Comprehensive Overview

item.title: Color palettes in R
item.description: R packages ggsci MapPalettes nationalparkcolors wesanderson viridis RColorBrewer paletteer colorspace package _brewer() function from ggplot2 Websites colorbrewer 2.0 open color ggplot color best tricks you will love Top R color palettes to know for great data visualization R packages ggsci Scientific Journal and Sci-Fi Themed Color Palettes for ggplot2 NPG: scale_color_npg() and scale_fill_npg() AAAS: scale_color_aaas() and scale_fill_aaas() NEJM Lancet JAMA JCO UCSCGB D3 LocusZoom IGV UChicago Star Trek Tron Legacy Futurama Rick and Morty The Simpsons pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + ggsci::scale_color_npg() MapPalettes MapPalettes green_machine, irish_flag, tealberry_pie, sunset, the_joker, bruiser # devtools::install_github("disarm-platform/MapPalettes") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, MapPalettes) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = MapPalettes::map_palette("tealberry_pie", 4)) nationalparkcolors nationalparkcolors # devtools::install_github("katiejolly/nationalparkcolors") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, nationalparkcolors) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = nationalparkcolors::park_palette("MtRainier", 4)) wesanderson wesanderson R package GitHub Wes Anderson Palettes pacman::p_load(wesanderson) names(wes_palettes) ## [1] "BottleRocket1" "BottleRocket2" "Rushmore1" "Rushmore" ## [5] "Royal1" "Royal2" "Zissou1" "Darjeeling1" ## [9] "Darjeeling2" "Chevalier1" "FantasticFox1" "Moonrise1" ## [13] "Moonrise2" "Moonrise3" "Cavalcanti1" "GrandBudapest1" ## [17] "GrandBudapest2" "IsleofDogs1" "IsleofDogs2" # devtools::install_github("karthik/wesanderson") pacman::p_load(dplyr, ggplot2, wesanderson) mtcars %>% filter(carb <= 4) %>% ggplot(aes(mpg, gear, color = factor(carb))) + geom_point(size = 4) + theme_classic() + scale_color_manual(values = wesanderson::wes_palette(n = 4, name = "GrandBudapest1")) viridis viridis viridisLite

item.title: 高影响力期刊发表，那些编辑和你的导师没有告诉过你的不成文的秘密
item.description: 此部分大部分来自于本人在美国队伍军人事务部临床流行病研究中心的工作经验。 期刊选择 主题的影响力和新颖程度 方法和数据分析的艺术性 投稿期刊的选择 作者组成 你所在的研究小组 信号与噪声：不牢靠的结果

item.title: 学术英文例句学习
item.description: The effect of cardiovascular outcomes has been less well characterized. The Trouble With Trucking But those drivers are the top echelon of the occupation and are not representative of the hundreds of thousands of people who toil in the industry’s underbelly. The previous requirements raised the cost of moving goods and stifled competition, but deregulation also took a toll on drivers by giving the industry a bigger financial incentive to lower costs and by weakening unions.

item.title: Data visualization using ggplot2
item.description: Kaplan-Meier survival plots using survminer One Kaplan-Meier plot using survminer survminer::ggsurvplot(survfit(utotalPSM ~ integ, data = total), pval = TRUE, conf.int = TRUE, legend.title = "Hospital type", legend.labs = c("Ordinary Hospitals", "Medical Consortium Hospitals"), submain = "Kaplan-Meier plot for a pool of three patient cohorts", xlab = "Survival length of stay", palette = c("firebrick1", "green4"), font.submain = c(16, "bold")) Arrange 3 survival plots plot3cohorts = survminer::arrange_ggsurvplots( list(ggfei.m, ggwei.m, ggshiguan.m), nrow = 3, ncol = 1) Code and data.

item.title: Rmarkdown .pdf tricks
item.description: LaTeX Header To make a lot of tricks work, you need to header-includes: - \usepackage{setspace}: spacing \doublespacing \singlespacing \linespread{1.5} - \AtBeginDocument{\let\maketitle\relax}: do not make title - \usepackage{lineno} \linenumbers - \usepackage[bottom]{footmisc}: make footnote on the first page to bottom - \usepackage{dcolumn}: to make stargazer tables work - \usepackage{lscape}: \newcommand{\blandscape}{\begin{landscape}} \newcommand{\elandscape}{\end{landscape}} Make a box around the content: \fbox{\begin{minipage}{\linewidth} 1. (11 Points: 2,3,3,3) Researchers are interested in .
